lead_paragraph: GUADALAJARA, Mexico -- The Mexican league restarted last weekend after its winter break, and it may have also reached a point of no return in violent incidents associated with, but peripheral, to the sport. The incidents also may help Mexicans' overcome their reluctance to discuss unpleasant subjects, especially when it comes to soccer, previously a refuge from the country's all-too violent reality.

headline.main: In Mexico, Violence Scars the Game
